**Sculpt Simulacrum** is a level 6 [Ice](/Ice "Ice")/[Alchemy](/Alchemy "Alchemy") spell which creates multiple [simulacra](/Simulacra "Simulacra") - frail, icy copies - from an adjacent monster. The simulacra take a few turns to form.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Useful Info

When used against a [natural](/Natural "Natural"), [demonic](/Demonic "Demonic"), or [holy](/Holy "Holy") monster, it creates 2-3 [blocks of ice](/Blocks_of_ice "Blocks of ice"). There is a `power/200` chance to create 3 blocks, otherwise it creates 2.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) These blocks of ice will turn into a [simulacrum](/Simulacrum "Simulacrum") of the monster after a short delay. The first block of ice takes 3-5 turns to become a simulacrum.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Each block of ice thereafter takes 1-3 turns longer than the previous. If destroyed by an attack, no simulacra is created.

Simulacra are [derived undead](/Derived_undead "Derived undead"); their stats depend on which monster you cast Sculpt Simulacrum on. Generally, they are frail, but with strong [cold](/Cold "Cold") attacks.

Simulacrum last for about 27 turns; spell power does not increase duration.

There is a cap of 5 simulacra. If this cap is reached, the oldest simulacra will be destroyed whenever a new one is formed.

This is not a [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy") spell, so [Gozag](/Gozag "Gozag") and [Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul") worshippers can use it without issue. However, the [good gods](/Good_god "Good god") still forbid its use.

## Strategy

Simulacra are glass cannons - strong but frail. The following are especially good/bad targets for Sculpt Simulacrum:

- Monsters with multiple attacks. Since each attack gets its own - very large - cold damage boost, having multiple attacks is obviously powerful. [Hydras](/Hydra "Hydra"), [entropy weavers](/Entropy_weaver "Entropy weaver"), and [ettins](/Ettin "Ettin") are all fair game, assuming you can survive melee combat against them. [The Lernaean hydra](/The_Lernaean_hydra "The Lernaean hydra") as a simulacrum can deal over 1000 damage per turn, but standing next to Lerny is too dangerous for most characters.
- Monsters with [constriction](/Constriction "Constriction") ([snakes](/List_of_reptiles_and_amphibians "List of reptiles and amphibians"), [tentacled monstrosities](/Tentacled_monstrosities "Tentacled monstrosities")). Their simulacra can also constrict foes, making them good allies.
- Conversely, avoid targeting physically deficient mages (such as [occultists](/Occultist "Occultist") and magical [deep elves](/List_of_deep_elves "List of deep elves")), as you'll spend 6 MP to create pathetic simulacra.

Also, since simulacra deal cold damage, avoid using Sculpt Simulacrum if most/all monsters in a group are heavily resistant to cold.

## History

- Sculpt Simulacrum was added in [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), replacing the [Simulacrum](/Simulacrum_\(spell\) "Simulacrum (spell)") spell.

Sculpt Simulacrum is a level 6 Ice/Alchemy spell which creates multiple simulacra - frail, icy copies - from an adjacent monster. The simulacra take a few turns to form.

Useful Info

There is a power/200 chance to create 3 blocks, otherwise it creates 2.[1] These blocks of ice will turn into a simulacrum of the monster after a short delay. The first block of ice takes 3-5 turns to become a simulacrum.[2] Each block of ice thereafter takes 1-3 turns longer than the previous. If destroyed by an attack, no simulacra is created.

Simulacra are derived undead; their stats depend on which monster you cast Sculpt Simulacrum on. Generally, they are frail, but with strong cold attacks.

There is a cap of 5 simulacra. If this cap is reached, the oldest simulacra will be destroyed whenever a new one is formed.

This is not a Necromancy spell, so Gozag and Yredelemnul worshippers can use it without issue. However, the good gods still forbid its use.

Strategy

Simulacra are glass cannons - strong but frail. The following are especially good/bad targets for Sculpt Simulacrum:

  • Monsters with multiple attacks. Since each attack gets its own - very large - cold damage boost, having multiple attacks is obviously powerful. Hydras, entropy weavers, and ettins are all fair game, assuming you can survive melee combat against them. The Lernaean hydra as a simulacrum can deal over 1000 damage per turn, but standing next to Lerny is too dangerous for most characters.

Also, since simulacra deal cold damage, avoid using Sculpt Simulacrum if most/all monsters in a group are heavily resistant to cold.
